entry.title: The Wrath That Might Have Been

link.title: The Wrath That Might Have Been

entry.content:
1. At the rising of the sun,
    2. From their hovels creep the working men
    3. And crawling from the forest muck, crawling from its den
    4. To the city - a sick thing wanders in
    1. It is almost like a man
    2. a rotten starving man
    1. Aching, shaking, crippled, crawling,
    2. The horrid thing, stinking filth
    3. Shudders down the city streets
    1. And with its wicked strength,
    2. All things it knocks aside
    3. Blind, unseeing
    4. The rats about which run and hide
    1. To the root it goes, to the city's center
    2. And fat from the city pours
    3. Fear of it's boiling wrath
    4. Enough the streets to crush and render
    1. To the root it goes, to the city's center
    2. Empty streets surround
    3. Cigarettes and needles, trash and embers
    1. From on high the newsmen watch
    2. Entranced in fear and shock
    3. How mighty must it once have been?
    4. This thing that struggles now to walk
    1. It should rage and shout
    2. Should - if sickness sound had not forgot
    3. It rages
    4. Silent as the lifeless streets around
    1. At red dusk - smoggy, tired, nervous hot
    2. It finds a fallen pole
    3. It stoops to lift the cudgel
    4. It lifts, tendons stretched taught
    5. It lifts - and stops, falls - on old pains caught
    1. From icy chills and sweat
    2. It boils fever fire hot
    3. It stoops
    4. And lifts, its club again
    1. Withs it's mighty club it strikes
    2. And all the earth it shakes
    3. And in seventy pieces tears
    4. the wrath that might have been
entry.summary: At the rising of the sun, From their hovels creep the working men And crawling from the forest muck, crawling from its den To the city - a sick thing wanders in

entry.title: Wotan
entry.content:
1. Of those all - that Wotan call, number in good homeless men
    2. to Valhalla they go - was one-eye I know - a hobo they ken
    1. For too many of hobos have talking heads
    2. And starved nine days without bread
    1. Have you slept in the rain? 'Neath a tree?
    2. I'll show you the runes - the triangle hands
    1. And all hobo's of old - the railroad rode
    2. You think Sleipnir was fast as the line?
    1. And a Norse god of old - should know how to drink
    2. So who would you have? - The drunk or the erg'?
    1. For a thief and a king - a warrior's dirge!
entry.summary: Of those all - that Wotan call, number in good homeless men to Valhalla they go - was one-eye I know - a hobo they ken

entry.title: Gacc/Gock
entry.content:
So I was idly browsing social media and hugging my blahaj in bed when I saw my mutuals’ post doing numbers on gacc/gock.

gacc/gock

The social media app for transbians by transbians. Clone an existing app but for a niche subgroup like college students or mentally ill men in dresses. Then expand. Or given the predilections of those on the platform inflate.

The eternal recurrence. If a demon appeared before you and told you “all that was shall be again” would you cringe or declare yourself a God? The Nietzschean ubermensch is here and she is a lolcow.

So I was staring at a time lapse of my friend’s supernumerary butt hole, an abscess drained last month ago. I suppose this was what Zhaungzhi meant by the pipes of heaven and earth. I had sworn a blood oath to stay off the chats but I suppose one little peek couldn’t hurt. The familiar cacophony overcame me as a vortex of fuck sucked me in.

Typically I used a katana but the current meta favored a Mosin Nagant. The dueling subprogram of the network was old, elegant and endlessly broken. The latest patches only try to contain the worst of the chaos. I should know as the maintainer.

The easiest way to find information is to get dirty. I hit the streets and greedily scarfed down the cigarette butts and needles littered about. Hey it’s VR they’re just bytes! Gradually I picked up an acrid trail.

Amongst the usual forums I found a black mass with a leaking stoma. Wendigo. I walked in chewing on one last cigarette butt.

“Hey it’s a genuine exploit!” I explained. “They never intended you to use cigarettes like this so it leaks metadata like crazy.”

I took another drink of coffee. It didn’t wash the taste out of my mouth but it helped to pretend it did.

Anon noted “uhuh I understood a bit of that.”
entry.summary: So I was idly browsing social media and hugging my blahaj in bed when I saw my mutuals’ post doing numbers on gacc/gock.

entry.title: I Know A Secret
entry.content:
1. "I know a secret"
    2. the creature said
    3. He sat there on the cobblestones
    4. in the darkness, just out of sight
    5. of the yellow sodium light
    1. We sat there for a while
    2. Me on the bench, him by the sea
    3. The wind not much
    4. by the waterfront
    1. The creature spoke again
    2. "a few years back,
    3. I was sitting not far from here
    4. in the darkness, just out of sight
    5. a man raped a girl under cover of the night"
    1. "I know a secret,
    2. for I see very well,
    3. even under - the night.
    4. These eyes catch many things
    5. I will never tell."
    1. "The truth came out
    2. decades later at the trial
    3. Your courts - are not like ours
    4. We have eyes - which catch
    5. The beating of the heart
    6. Whispers - inside the throat
    1. I saw an old man ill and dying
    2. too rich and sick for jail
    3. When he was coughing sputum up
    4. I was sitting there
    5. I know a secret
    6. and I will never tell
entry.summary: "I know a secret" the creature said He sat there on the cobblestones in the darkness, just out of sight of the yellow sodium light

entry.title: Morpheus
entry.content:
1. Oh formless one
    1. sing me, send me pleasant sights - sing me, send me horrid frights
    1. show me darkness - and dawning of the day
    2. and let me dream of - what I dreamt I locked away
    4. let me lose my heart - like an empty fool
    5. let me be a thief and king - to serve and rule
    1. all these things show to me - there is naught I wouldn't know
    2. to drink of memory - to the depths of Hell I'd go
    1. down to the lake of fire - to the cracks of mind
    2. where unformed men - crawl through muck and grime
    1. that wail and groan to us - these partial things afire
    2. who lack tongue or eye or arm or bone
    1. all things alight in flame, till even darkness fire consume
    2. naught left but flame and gnashing teeth, the final doom
    1. and to these ashes - let me dream
    2. let me see a niad - a mirror river stream
    1. show me singing of the stars - heavenly wine
    2. mad with love and loss - let me lose my mind
    1. please send me a dream of - delirious ecstasy
    2. formless one, a formless dream to me
    1. a thousand wars and - hosannas singing saviour
    2. and sick and drunken one - leaning 'gainst the wall
    1. a red and swollen sky - beating like a drum
    2. the battle ground - just a fantasy
    1. let me dream it all - dream dreams dreaming dreams for me

entry.title: Bed
entry.content:
1. Tired, hot - both my arms and more
    2. Wheels in my head - unbalanced turning
    3. My nose and nasal tunnels - itchy, sore
    4. Dry throat - cracked and burning
    1. My poor stomach - rolling, churning
    2. Hot, ugly - a fever in my head
    3. I should have stayed in bed
entry.summary: Tired, hot - both my arms and more Wheels in my head - unbalanced turning My nose and nasal tunnels - itchy, sore Dry throat - cracked and burning

entry.title: Night Walk
entry.content:
Ollie pulled down his long sleeved shirt and stared at his pasty dry arms in the bathroom mirror. The moles were climbing along his arm. One mole in particular was cracked and infected.

Ollie plugged the bathtub and turned off the lights. Ollie slowly pulled himself into the bathtub and once seated turned on the tap. Ollie twitched as fear gripped his heart like a tapeworm.

I wake up late in the afternoon with a splitting headache. TMJ, bad posture and too much time on the internet. I swallow a Tylenol and pull myself out of bed. By sunset I make it to the door. I throw on a large coat to hide my meagre gyno and head out.

Ollie began the day’s ceremony of grinding coffee. Ollie unplugged the coffee grinder. Ollie poured in the coffee beans. Ollie plugged in the coffee grinder. Ollie thought about putting his fingers in the coffee grinder. Ollie ground the coffee. Ollie unplugged the coffee grinder. Ollie spotted left out scissors on the countertop. Ollie thought about sticking the scissors in his eyes. Ollie put the scissors away in the drawer beneath the countertop.

Downtown, I sip a cup of coffee comatose in a chain coffee shop until near midnight. It’s very quiet and there’s no traffic on the street. You can walk across the road pretty freely and there’s a pleasant feeling like soft cotton in your head.

In the dark in the bad parts of town out among the street people I start to feel a little alive.

Ollie took a cup of coffee and a slice of banana bread to the little table in the hall outside the college library proper. Ollie crumpled over his laptop and began to exorcise the images that dug like wasps against his skull.

“Earlier that day a man and a woman kissed in the park. I thought: I should tackle the girl to the ground and I should smash her head against the pavement and I should rape her.”

I take a shit in a public bathroom in Victory square. A massive constipation coffee dump. The guy in the room watching everything reminds me to flush. Fucker.

I walk home down through China town. I’m tall and keep away from those roaming about at these hours. A deep anger keeps me moving on through the cool air.

Ollie rushed out of the classroom claiming he needed to go to the toilet. Ollie’s balls hurt. Ollie’s balls hurt a lot. In the toilet stall Ollie fiddled with his nuts. Balls in a rubber sack the cords caught twisted burning.

I make it home my legs all tired and the spite worked out a little. I turn off the lights and lie down prone in bed under the covers and I masturbate with my fist pressuring myself thinking of women and cock. I touch my chest and I think of shiny goddesses.

Ollie orgasmed face down grinding his hips against his bed and hand and staining the sheets with clear fluid and a foul smell.
entry.summary: Ollie pulled down his long sleeved shirt and stared at his pasty dry arms in the bathroom mirror. The moles were climbing along his arm. One mole in particular was cracked and infected.

entry.title: The Rock
entry.content:
1. What clay figure sickly rotten, stands before us
    2. unformed, smashed / mockery of God's begotten?
    3. Do you think? Do you think?
    4. Do you have a mind?
    5. Are you man or golem?
entry.summary: What clay figure sickly rotten, stands before us unformed, smashed / mockery of God's begotten? Do you think? Do you think? Do you have a mind? Are you man or golem?

entry.title: Coffee
entry.content:
Day 8 of no coffee, captains log

My body boils like a bubbling pot of pastrami noodles. The wet red meat mess gravy of my brain congeals over the stove top. I am frying eggs sunnyside up. I close my eyes and aeons pass. I open my eyes and it is another world. I remember Tuesday fondly.

My head a pounding agony lying trapped beneath the embrace of my oneitis and enfolded in the choking intoxication of a vape fiend’s addiction in a closet sized apartment.

I sequester protein sequences deep inside my intestine. The warm wet egg yolk dirtying my fine trimmed facial hair. Breakfast as usual is a tense quiet affair. We are not hopeful today.
entry.summary: Day 8 of no coffee, captains log

entry.title: Two Girls
entry.content:
1. Two young girls walking 'cross the streets
    2. auburn hair, tanned skin, lovely eyes
    3. hand in hand, short black skirts, high heels
    4. bruises on the back of thighs
entry.summary: Two young girls walking 'cross the streets auburn hair, tanned skin, lovely eyes hand in hand, short black skirts, high heels bruises on the back of thighs
